law.catch_line: Criminal simulation in the first degree.

text.section: A person is guilty of criminal simulation in the first degree when he or she knowingly manufactures, markets, or distributes any product which is intended to defraud a test designed to detect the presence of alcohol or a controlled substance.
Criminal simulation in the first degree is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 94, sec. 1, effective July 13, 2004.
